intro: Pedicularis flavida, commonly known as the yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically yellow or orange in color. It grows in moist, shaded habitats and has a taproot system that allows it to absorb nutrients from the soil. Pedicularis flavida is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas where it thrives in cooler climates.
